decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - 1.	The internally illuminated advertisement hoardings, by virtue of their size, position, design and appearance, cause clutter and visual blight in this location, visible from the Historic Park and Metropolitan Open Land to the north, residential and Conservation Areas to the north, east and south, being out of character with and damaging the amenity of, the surrounding areas, contrary to advice in PPG 19 and Policies Env-B.1.1, ENV-B 1.2, ENV-B 2.2, ENV-B 2.9, ENV-B 1.4, ENV-N 1.7, ENV-N 1.15, ENV-N 1.16 and ENV-B 2.8 of this Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan and London Plan policies

Condition : 2 - 2.	The advertisement hoardings, because of their number, size and position, and because of the architectural inappropriateness of the panels and light pollution emanating from the signs, have an unacceptable impact on local amenity and fail to have regard for visual amenity in accordance with the Town & Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) Regulations 2007 and also be contrary to Policies ENV-B 1.1, ENV-B 1.2, ENV-B 1.4, ENV-B 2.2,  ENV -P 1.7 ENV-N 1.15, ENV-N 1.16 and ENV-B 2.8 of the Council's Unitary Development Plan and London Plan policies

Condition : 3 - 2.	The advertisement hoardings, because of their number, size and position, and because of the architectural inappropriateness of the panels and light pollution emanating from the signs, have an unacceptable impact on local amenity and fail to have regard for visual amenity in accordance with the Town & Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) Regulations 2007 and also be contrary to Policies ENV-B 1.1, ENV-B 1.2, ENV-B 1.4, ENV-B 2.2,  ENV -P 1.7 ENV-N 1.15, ENV-N 1.16 and ENV-B 2.8 of the Council's Unitary Development Plan and London Plan policies
